content:
Diagnosis
	1. Unclassified renal cell carcinoma, right kidney lower pole
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right cytoreductive nephrectomy
	Complicated by post-operative collection requiring drainage

	Systemic therapy
	1 Mar 2024 Commenced Cabozantinib 60mg daily
	15 Apr 2024 Dose reduction to 40mg daily due to grade 3 palmar-plantar syndrome

	Radiotherapy
	10 Apr 2024 8Gy single fraction to T12 vertebral metastasis

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new liver lesions and worsening bone metastases

	Current issues
	1. Deteriorating performance status
	2. Increasing right upper quadrant pain
	3. Symptomatic hypercalcemia

	Summary of consultation
	This 62-year-old gentleman has unfortunately shown clear evidence of disease progression on his most recent imaging. CT performed on 1 May 2024 demonstrates enlargement of existing liver metastases and appearance of three new lesions in segments 7 and 8. There is also progression of bone metastases with new lesions in T8 and L3 vertebrae.

His performance status has declined to ECOG 2-3, spending more than 50% of the day resting. He reports increasing right upper quadrant pain requiring escalation of opioid analgesia, now on MST 60mg BD. Recent blood tests show rising calcium at 3.1mmol/L despite previous zoledronic acid.

On examination today, there is marked hepatomegaly extending 4cm below costal margin with tenderness on palpation. Reduced air entry at right lung base. No peripheral edema.

	Further investigations
	1. Urgent serum calcium and renal function
	2. MRI spine to assess cord compression risk at T8

	Medication changes
	1. Commenced on urgent IV fluids and zoledronic acid for hypercalcemia
	2. MST increased to 90mg BD
	3. Cabozantinib discontinued due to disease progression

	Follow up
	1. Urgent review in 1 week with blood results
	2. Discussion at RCC MDT regarding second-line therapy options

	Required actions
	1. Referral to palliative care team completed
	2. District nurse referral for support with medication administration
	3. GP to monitor renal function and calcium levels twice weekly
